home.title: Vulnerability prioritization that makes sense
home.description1: Titt PÃ¥ Ting is a prioritization tool meant to filter out noise and uncertainty.
home.description2: Not all vulnerabilities are created equal and we've done the work for you to analyze and rank the most critical vulnerabilities in the teams you belong to. The vulnerability list is fetched from the Nais API.

summary.priorityWarning: Prioritization is based on available information. A vulnerability can be critical even if it's prioritized low, for example if it hasn't been analyzed yet.

teamFilter.title: Filter by team
teamFilter.description: Select which teams you want to see vulnerabilities for. Only selected teams will be shown on the main page.

vulnerabilitiesPage.title: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilitiesPage.description: The table is based on all applications that have generated an SBOM for nais console, and are in a namespace you belong to.

workload.explanationTitle: Explanation of terms and risk scoring

kev.heading: KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities)
kev.description: KEV is a list from CISA (Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency) of vulnerabilities that are actively exploited on the internet. KEV entries represent a real, documented threat.

epss.heading: EPSS (Exploit Prediction Scoring System)
epss.description: EPSS is a data-driven system that calculates the probability that a vulnerability will be exploited within the next 30 days. A higher EPSS score indicates greater likelihood of active exploitation.

ingressTypes.heading: Ingress Types
ingressTypes.external: External: The application is exposed to the internet without authentication. This provides the largest attack surface.
ingressTypes.authenticated: Authenticated: The application is exposed to the internet but requires authentication. This provides moderate increased risk.
ingressTypes.internal: Internal: The application is only available internally in the network. This provides normal risk.
ingressTypes.unknown: Unknown/None: No ingress is configured. This means the application is only available via service discovery.

workload.riskScoreDescription: The risk score is calculated by taking into account multiple factors including CVE severity, KEV status, EPSS score, ingress type, production environment, and build age. Higher value means it's more urgent.
